events.originalText: The United States Department of Justice released a redacted version of the Mueller report about the investigation of Russian influence on the U.S. presidential election to Congress and the public.
events.subtitle: United States Department of Justice
events.headline: Mueller Report Released by U.S. Department of Justice

events.originalText: A ladle spilled 30 tonnes (33 tons) of molten steel in a factory in Liaoning, China, killing 32 workers.
events.subtitle: Qinghe Special Steel Corporation disaster
events.headline: Tragic Accident in Liaoning, China: 32 Workers Killed by Molten Steel Spill

events.originalText: Operation Grapes of Wrath: Israeli forces shelled Qana, Lebanon, killing at least 100 civilians and injuring more than 110 others at a United Nations compound.
events.subtitle: Operation Grapes of Wrath
events.headline: Israeli Forces Shell Qana, Lebanon, Killing Over 100 Civilians

events.originalText: Robert Mugabe (pictured) became the first prime minister of Zimbabwe, beginning a 37-year period in power.
events.subtitle: Robert Mugabe
events.headline: Robert Mugabe Becomes First Prime Minister of Zimbabwe

events.originalText: Controversial American poet Ezra Pound was released from St. Elizabeths Hospital, a psychiatric hospital in Washington, D.C., in which he had been incarcerated for twelve years.
events.subtitle: Ezra Pound
events.headline: Controversial Poet Ezra Pound Released from Psychiatric Hospital

events.originalText: The Republic of Ireland Act 1948 came into force, declaring Ireland a republic and terminating its membership in the British Commonwealth of Nations.
events.subtitle: The Republic of Ireland Act 1948
events.headline: Republic of Ireland Declared a Republic, Leaves British Commonwealth

events.originalText: The final session of the League of Nations concluded in Geneva, with delegates agreeing to transfer much of its assets to the United Nations.
events.subtitle: League of Nations
events.headline: League of Nations Concludes Final Session, Transfers Assets to UN

events.originalText: Superman, created by Jerry Siegel and Joe Shuster of DC Comics, made his debut in Action Comics #1, the first true superhero comic book.
events.subtitle: Superman
events.headline: Superman Makes Debut in Action Comics #1

events.originalText: World War I: Hit by ground fire, French aviation pioneer Roland Garros (pictured) landed his aircraft behind enemy lines and was taken prisoner.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: French Aviation Pioneer Roland Garros Taken Prisoner in WWI

events.originalText: The painted ceilings of the Natural History Museum, London, were unveiled when the building opened its doors to the public.
events.subtitle: Ceilings of the Natural History Museum, London
events.headline: Natural History Museum in London Unveils Painted Ceilings

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: Colonists Paul Revere and William Dawes, later joined by Samuel Prescott, began a midnight ride to warn residents of Lexington and Concord, Massachusetts, about the impending arrival of British troops.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: Paul Revere and William Dawes Begin Midnight Ride in American Revolutionary War

events.originalText: Glorious Revolution: Provincial militia and citizens in Boston revolted, arresting officials of the Dominion of New England.
events.subtitle: Glorious Revolution
events.headline: Revolt in Boston During Glorious Revolution: Officials Arrested
